Key Match Events: Luka Doncic scored 30 points in the game.
A controversial call and a last-second foul on Jusuf Nurkic led to the Suns' victory.
Doncic argued with officials after the game due to frustration over the controversial call.
Doncic briefly grabbed his right ankle and was seen limping after being clipped by Jusuf Nurkic.
The Suns built an early 36-26 lead in the first quarter, sinking eight three-pointers.
Tyus Jones led all scorers with eight points in the opening minutes.
Phoenix went into halftime with a 63-50 lead after shooting 53.5% from the field.
Doncic scored a game-high 16 points by halftime.
Dallas tied the game at 65-65 in the third quarter.
The Suns led 87-83 going into the fourth quarter.
The Mavericks pulled ahead by six points before the Suns regained a slim 98-97 lead.
Nurkic tied the game at 111 with a minute left.
Durant missed a three-pointer, but Nurkic's rebound and slam put Phoenix up by two with 30 seconds remaining.
A foul on Nurkic in the last seconds sent him to the line, where he made the second free throw to secure a one-point win for Phoenix.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic expressed visible frustration and argued with officials after the game.
There have not been any official reactions or responses from Doncic as of the article's writing.
